commit_message:
Eliminate type error on search_s

Guard the list comprehension to eliminate 'None' valued keys from
the attrlist from causing an exception when trying to iterate on
the None singleton.

related-bug: #1231772
Change-Id: I823a53d100b5e4210c767507e3233b61ed372068
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/58/48558/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if attrlist is not None: attrlist = [attr for attr in attrlist if attr is not None]
deleted_lines: attrlist = [attr for attr in attrlist if attr is not None]

subject: Update user_attribute_ignore for LDAP Identity config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-25 06:49:56.000000000', 'files': ['lib/keystone'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/2dc11fb5c843ccf057fac9e01cf6beca7d877421', 'message': "Update user_attribute_ignore for LDAP Identity config

With a recent patch to keystone, the use of tenantId, tenant_id, and
default_project_id was normalized to reference default_project_id for
all cases internally and translate to the expected results at the
controller (v2.0 returns tenantId, v3 returns default_project_id).

Devstack must now properly ignore the expected mapped LDAP attribute
of 'default_project_id' instead of the old 'tenantId'.  Without this
fix devstack will fail when using the LDAP identity backend because
the 'default_project_id' has been made a special case that requires
the operator of a Openstack cloud to explicitly choose an attribute
to map 'default_project_id' to if storing that value is desired.
Without explicitly mapping that attribute and not having it in the
'user_attribute_ignore' config option, the user_creates can fail.

related-bug: 1219739
Change-Id: I1dd3719de50f6d0948b3a9743e32a03d0ac56b3c
"}]
commit_message:
Update user_attribute_ignore for LDAP Identity config

With a recent patch to keystone, the use of tenantId, tenant_id, and
default_project_id was normalized to reference default_project_id for
all cases internally and translate to the expected results at the
controller (v2.0 returns tenantId, v3 returns default_project_id).

Devstack must now properly ignore the expected mapped LDAP attribute
of 'default_project_id' instead of the old 'tenantId'.  Without this
fix devstack will fail when using the LDAP identity backend because
the 'default_project_id' has been made a special case that requires
the operator of a Openstack cloud to explicitly choose an attribute
to map 'default_project_id' to if storing that value is desired.
Without explicitly mapping that attribute and not having it in the
'user_attribute_ignore' config option, the user_creates can fail.

related-bug: 1219739
Change-Id: I1dd3719de50f6d0948b3a9743e32a03d0ac56b3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/89/48189/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $KEYSTONE_CONF ldap user_attribute_ignore "enabled,email,tenants,default_project_id"

commit_message:
Print the lekaed 'boto' tags on Failure

Asserting an an array length is not too informative on failure.
So let's add the str represnation of the list to the assertion.

Change-Id: Iaace6ada86a5e4b3e7ef60e09748d65c009915eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/83/48283/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertEqual(len(tags), 0, str(tags)) self.assertEqual(len(tags), 0, str(tags))

commit_message:
ML2 Cisco Nexus mech driver portbinding support

This commit adds portbinding extension support to
the cisco nexus mechanism driver.

Fixes bug: 1220878

Change-Id: I72003961b46190b82681b471f4f9cb5b11d3d068
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/86/48686/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.common import constants as n_const from neutron.extensions import portbindings def _get_vlanid(self, context): if context.bound_segment: return context.bound_segment.get(api.SEGMENTATION_ID) def _valid_device_owner(self, port): return 'compute:' in port['device_owner'] def _valid_status(self, port): return port['status'] == n_const.PORT_STATUS_ACTIVE def _invoke_nexus_on_port_event(self, context): host_id = context.current.get(portbindings.HOST_ID) if vlan_id and host_id: vlan_name = cfg.CONF.ml2_cisco.vlan_name_prefix + str(vlan_id) instance_id = context.current.get('device_id') self._manage_port(vlan_name, vlan_id, host_id, instance_id) else: LOG.debug(_("Vlan ID %(vlan_id)s or Host ID %(host_id)s missing."), {'vlan_id': vlan_id, 'host_id': host_id}) if self._valid_device_owner(port) and self._valid_status(port): self._invoke_nexus_on_port_event(context) if not self._valid_device_owner(context.current): return
deleted_lines: from novaclient.v1_1 import client as nova_client def _get_vlanid(self, port_context): """Return the VLAN ID (segmentation ID) for this network.""" # NB: Currently only a single physical network is supported. network_context = port_context.network network_segments = network_context.network_segments return network_segments[0]['segmentation_id'] # TODO(rcurran) Temporary access to host_id. When available use # port-binding to access host name. def _get_instance_host(self, instance_id): keystone_conf = cfg.CONF.keystone_authtoken keystone_auth_url = '%s://%s:%s/v2.0/' % (keystone_conf.auth_protocol, keystone_conf.auth_host, keystone_conf.auth_port) nc = nova_client.Client(keystone_conf.admin_user, keystone_conf.admin_password, keystone_conf.admin_tenant_name, keystone_auth_url, no_cache=True) serv = nc.servers.get(instance_id) host = serv.__getattr__('OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host') return host def _invoke_nexus_on_port_event(self, context, instance_id): """Prepare variables for call to nexus switch.""" host = self._get_instance_host(instance_id) # Trunk segmentation id for only this host vlan_name = cfg.CONF.ml2_cisco.vlan_name_prefix + str(vlan_id) self._manage_port(vlan_name, vlan_id, host, instance_id) def create_port_postcommit(self, context): """Create port post-database commit event.""" port = context.current instance_id = port['device_id'] device_owner = port['device_owner'] if instance_id and device_owner != 'network:dhcp': self._invoke_nexus_on_port_event(context, instance_id) old_port = context.original old_device = old_port['device_id'] instance_id = port['device_id'] if 'device_id' in port else "" # Check if there's a new device_id if instance_id and not old_device: self._invoke_nexus_on_port_event(context, instance_id)

commit_message:
Removes pre_live_migration need for Fixed IPs

This commit removes the validation that requires Fixed IP Addresses
for pre_live_migration.  The original comment regarding the
pre_live_migration requiring Fixed IP Addresses alluded to uncertainty
about it not being required.  Workloads should not require a Fixed IP
Address for migration, typically just the storage is required to be
similar.

The commit also updates the associated test case to ensure that no
exception is thrown in the pre_live_migration if a fixed IP Address
is not specified.

Change-Id: I2c4d4dae2cb0f00c67f0f731b5080196564b37da
Closes-Bug: #1226226
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/47479/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
skip test_run_stop_terminate_instance

This test case leads to frequent recheck on the neutron gate,
both at instance creation and instance deletion wait.

This is the simplest ec2 instance test, ec2 api does not do anything
special what the nova does not. It is also very strange just only this
test case causes issues.

Looks like soma state information is different on the services.

Related Bug #1223161

Change-Id: Ic5b88fb321b1c389280d0ce15de8842a24be9e1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/12/48412/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @testtools.skip("Skipped until the Bug #1223161 is resolved")

commit_message:
Correctly set the L3 service plugin for ML2

ML2 uses a service plugin for L3. This patch to devstack
correctly sets this by setting or updating the variable
Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES, which makes ML2 compatible when
running with other service plugins (e.g. LBaaS and VPN).

Fixes bug 1231622

Change-Id: I0ce1f5a42bd052995135ffac1ee5ef382d69789e

commit_message:
Normalise RECLONE flag to True Or False.

RECLONE flag now uses function trueorfalse for flag handling.
Added more flag cases to normalisation function trueorfalse.

Fixes bug #1200382

Change-Id: I0738537c87634281c6a92fa93b7f84a6b0dad497
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/84/48184/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RECLONE=$(trueorfalse False $RECLONE) elif [[ "$RECLONE" = "True" ]]; then# Accepts as False: 0 no No NO false False FALSE # Accepts as True: 1 yes Yes YES true True TRUE [[ "0 no No NO false False FALSE" =~ "$testval" ]] && { echo "False"; return; } [[ "1 yes Yes YES true True TRUE" =~ "$testval" ]] && { echo "True"; return; }
deleted_lines: elif [[ "$RECLONE" == "yes" ]]; then# Accepts as False: 0 no false False FALSE # Accepts as True: 1 yes true True TRUE [[ "0 no false False FALSE" =~ "$testval" ]] && { echo "False"; return; } [[ "1 yes true True TRUE" =~ "$testval" ]] && { echo "True"; return; }

commit_message:
Expose all versions of Ironic API

In the observable future new versions of the Ironic
API will appear. That's why it's reasonable to expose
the endpoint that will provide access to all versions
of the API.

Closes-Bug: #1229780
Change-Id: I4ec2b45688da3fa6c0d43e8be60885774cfbffd6

Clean CONF out of brick exception

This is part 3 of the work needed to
remove CONF from the brick subproject.

This patch removes the CONF usage in
the brick exception.

Fixes bug #1230066

commit_message:
Remove deprecated task states

Task states STARTING and STOPPING were replaced with POWERING_ON and
POWERING_OFF in Grizzly and can now be removed.

Change-Id: I0a29f9aad5689c6401a0f76561cbe46ae2d8e0fb

commit_message:
Use auto-delete exclusive reply queues for QPID

Closes-Bug: #1228600
Change-Id: Ied14b2fd943bed42dd3745d4c6d759d8d76a6fa6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/87/47687/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, session, callback, node_name, node_opts=None, link_opts=None): 'node_name' the source of the messages - the first part of the Qpid address string, before ';' 'node_opts' will be applied to the "node" section in the address string options. 'link_opts' will be applied to the "link" section in the address string options. # An address has the following format # "<source>[/<subject>]; {<address-options>} addr_opts = {"create": "always"} if node_opts: addr_opts["node"] = node_opts if link_opts: addr_opts['link'] = link_opts { # node_opt "type": "queue", "x-declare": { # use auto-delete, since the name is random (msg_id), we # can no longer use the queue after the consumer # exits. Otherwise, the queue will never be reclaimed by # the broker. "auto-delete": True, "exclusive": True, } { # node_opts "type": "topic", "durable": True, }, { # link_opts "name": name or topic, "x-declare": { "auto-delete": conf.amqp_auto_delete, "exclusive": False } { # node_opts "type": "topic", "durable": True, "x-declare": { "type": "fanout", "auto-delete": True, } }, { # link_opts "name": "%s_fanout_%s" % (topic, uuid.uuid4().hex), "durable": False, "x-declare": { # use auto-delete, since the name is random (uuid4), we can # no longer use the queue after the consumer exits. # Otherwise, the queue will never be reclaimed by the # broker. "auto-delete": True, "exclusive": True } }) "durable": False, "x-declare": { addr_opts["node"].update(node_opts) {"type": "queue"}) "%s_fanout" % topic, { "x-declare": { "type": "fanout", "auto-delete": True } })
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, session, callback, node_name, node_opts, link_name, link_opts): 'node_name' is the first part of the Qpid address string, before ';' 'node_opts' will be applied to the "x-declare" section of "node" in the address string. 'link_name' goes into the "name" field of the "link" in the address string 'link_opts' will be applied to the "x-declare" section of "link" in the address string. addr_opts = { "create": "always", "node": { "type": "topic", "x-declare": { "durable": True, "auto-delete": True, }, }, "link": { "name": link_name, "durable": True, "x-declare": { "durable": False, "auto-delete": True, "exclusive": False, }, }, } addr_opts["node"]["x-declare"].update(node_opts) addr_opts["link"]["x-declare"].update(link_opts) "%s/%s" % (msg_id, msg_id), {"type": "direct"}, { "auto-delete": conf.amqp_auto_delete, "exclusive": True, "durable": conf.amqp_durable_queues, {}, name or topic, { "auto-delete": conf.amqp_auto_delete, {"durable": False, "type": "fanout"}, "%s_fanout_%s" % (topic, uuid.uuid4().hex), {"exclusive": True}) "x-declare": { "durable": False, addr_opts["node"]["x-declare"].update(node_opts) {"type": "direct"}) "%s_fanout" % topic, {"type": "fanout"})

commit_message:
Define a way to load storage back-ends

With this patch, those who load their own back-ends should be able
to stop overriding private methods of AccountController and
ContainerController. However, the testing was not exhaustive just yet.
We only made sure that we're not breaking the existing Swift.

Note that this commit inserts a common way to load DiskFile and
DB broker classes in every place they are used. This is actually
a fiction at present, because additional dependencies on the on-disk
layout exist due to assumptions in auditors and replicators.
We do it purely for uniformity.

This version disposes with confusing and misleading names, such as
"lfs" and "group", and is configured in one place, swift.conf, for
all servers and daemons.

Change-Id: I2aaea02f98a27be1225a06ce60336c13ba62993b

commit_message:
Continue to use implicit nullable=True in sqlalchemy

Change-Id I22fe2d0caca77005553a6a6f0c7cc2d3e8ea5512 removed some nullable=True
statements because in sqlalchemy nullable is set to True by default.

In migrations, there are some column definitions telling nullable=True, which
is not necessary, so this patch is to remove them.

Change-Id: Ice6bb74ffbc518a948d0e06ba150289b2106df05
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add error log for SystemExit in l3-agent

The SystemExit exception should be logged in l3-agent, the
operator may miss the useful exception messages to debug.

    * Add error log for SystemExit in l3-agent.
    * Add unit test for None and Wrong interface_driver.

Closes-Bug #1229105

Change-Id: I9ac60a528c1e88827078d552a30c8d571066d21c

subject: Fix auto-deletion of ports and subnets in ML2

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-27 22:58:20.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/19804bb5c5ad8ba10fbda1bf213f698d97c137e7', 'message': "Fix auto-deletion of ports and subnets in ML2

Ml2Plugin.delete_network() is changed to not use the base class's

commit_message:
Fix auto-deletion of ports and subnets in ML2

When a network is deleted, certain ports and any subnets referencing
it are auto-deleted. The implementation of
NeutronDBPluginV2.delete_network() does this at the DB level, so ML2's
mechanism drivers were not being called.

Ml2Plugin.delete_network() is changed to not use the base class's
method, and to auto-delete ports and subnets by calling its own
delete_port() and delete_subnet() methods outside of the
transaction. A loop avoids race conditions with ports or subnets being
asynchronously added to the network.

Closes-Bug: 1230330
Change-Id: Icf21400c9938eec29d70da8497b9ef92642131e2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/65/48765/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # REVISIT(rkukura) The super(Ml2Plugin, self).delete_network() # function is not used because it auto-deletes ports and # subnets from the DB without invoking the derived class's # delete_port() or delete_subnet(), preventing mechanism # drivers from being called. This approach should be revisited # when the API layer is reworked during icehouse. while True: with session.begin(subtransactions=True): filter = {'network_id': [id]} # Get ports to auto-delete. ports = self.get_ports(context, filters=filter) only_auto_del = all(p['device_owner'] in db_base_plugin_v2. AUTO_DELETE_PORT_OWNERS for p in ports) if not only_auto_del: raise exc.NetworkInUse(net_id=id) # Get subnets to auto-delete. subnets = self.get_subnets(context, filters=filter) if not ports or subnets: network = self.get_network(context, id) mech_context = driver_context.NetworkContext(self, context, network) self.mechanism_manager.delete_network_precommit( mech_context) record = self._get_network(context, id) context.session.delete(record) for segment in mech_context.network_segments: self.type_manager.release_segment(session, segment) # The segment records are deleted via cascade from the # network record, so explicit removal is not necessary. break for port in ports: self.delete_port(context, port['id']) for subnet in subnets: self.delete_subnet(context, subnet['id'])
deleted_lines: with session.begin(subtransactions=True): network = self.get_network(context, id) mech_context = driver_context.NetworkContext(self, context, network) self.mechanism_manager.delete_network_precommit(mech_context) super(Ml2Plugin, self).delete_network(context, id) for segment in mech_context.network_segments: self.type_manager.release_segment(session, segment) # The segment records are deleted via cascade from the # network record, so explicit removal is not necessary.

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V agent RPC calls for ML2 support

Adds support for the RPC report status in the Hyper-V
agent and plugin.

Fixes bug: #1226654

Change-Id: Ie5eee875afc062c536856589d6a3fd0414190f6d

commit_message:
Use built-in print() instead of print statement

In python 3 print statement is not supported, so we should use
only print() functions.

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: I6f55dafb8f272e503dac34f59a9731e992a5ceaa

Fixes bug 1206809

Currently the libvirt xml of instance will be generated every time
during hard reboot by get_guest_config and to_xml method in libvirt
driver, but the image_meta is not passed into the get_guest_config
method like spawn(), so some configs related to the image_meta will
be lost(compared with the spawn process), we need to get the

commit_message:
Get image metadata in to_xml for generating xml

The to_xml method of libvirt driver will generate xml file of instance
during hard reboot/spawn/rescue/migrate and other operations, and the
image_meta is used for generating correct xml of instance.
But the accurate image_meta may not be passed into the get_guest_config,
so some configs related to the image_meta will be lost, we need to get the
image metadata if it is not passed to the to_xml method.

Fixes bug 1206809
Change-Id: I6942837905334a652cda64d7dd41d3b575846d93

commit_message:
Validate token calls return 404 on invalid tokens

Invalid X-Subject-Token was resulting in HTTP 401 rather than 404
This is causing the auth_token middleware to re-authenticate
It expects a 404 on an invalid token.

Change-Id: Ieb4cbd4f69b4f3c5944eebc262e694e831d1ca6d
Fixed-Bug: #1221889
Fixed-Bug: #1186059
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/23/46123/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # 401 is not a correct test as the x-auth-token passed the auth # Also as per doc identity-api-v3.md#400-bad-request his should be 404 self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=404)class TestTokenRevokeSelfAndAdmin(test_v3.RestfulTestCase): """Test token revoke using v3 Identity API by token owner and admin.""" def setUp(self): """Setup for Test Cases. One domain A Two users userNormalA and userAdminA """ super(TestTokenRevokeSelfAndAdmin, self).setUp() self.domainA = self.new_domain_ref() self.domainA['name'] = 'test-domainA' self.identity_api.create_domain(self.domainA['id'], self.domainA) self.userAdminA = self.new_user_ref(domain_id=self.domainA['id']) self.userAdminA['password'] = uuid.uuid4().hex self.identity_api.create_user(self.userAdminA['id'], self.userAdminA) self.userNormalA = self.new_user_ref( domain_id=self.domainA['id']) self.userNormalA['password'] = uuid.uuid4().hex self.identity_api.create_user(self.userNormalA['id'], self.userNormalA) self.role1 = self.new_role_ref() self.role1['name'] = 'admin' self.identity_api.create_role(self.role1['id'], self.role1) self.identity_api.create_grant(self.role1['id'], user_id=self.userAdminA['id'], domain_id=self.domainA['id']) # Finally, switch to the v3 sample policy file self.orig_policy_file = CONF.policy_file from keystone.policy.backends import rules rules.reset() self.opt(policy_file=test.etcdir('policy.v3cloudsample.json')) def test_revoke_token_self(self): r = self.post( '/auth/tokens', body=self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.userNormalA['id'], password=self.userNormalA['password'], user_domain_id=self.domainA['id'])) user_token = r.headers.get('X-Subject-Token') self.assertNotEmpty(user_token) headers = {'X-Subject-Token': user_token} r = self.post( '/auth/tokens', body=self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.userAdminA['id'], password=self.userAdminA['password'], domain_name=self.domainA['name'])) adminA_token = r.headers.get('X-Subject-Token') self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=204, token=adminA_token) self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=204, token=user_token) self.delete('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=204, token=user_token) self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=401, token=user_token) self.delete('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=401, token=user_token) self.delete('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=404, token=adminA_token) self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=404, token=adminA_token) def test_revoke_token_adminA(self): r = self.post( '/auth/tokens', body=self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.userNormalA['id'], password=self.userNormalA['password'], user_domain_id=self.domainA['id'])) user_token = r.headers.get('X-Subject-Token') self.assertNotEmpty(user_token) headers = {'X-Subject-Token': user_token} r = self.post( '/auth/tokens', body=self.build_authentication_request( user_id=self.userAdminA['id'], password=self.userAdminA['password'], domain_name=self.domainA['name'])) adminA_token = r.headers.get('X-Subject-Token') self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=204, token=adminA_token) self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=204, token=user_token) self.delete('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=204, token=adminA_token) self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=401, token=user_token) self.delete('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=404, token=adminA_token) self.head('/auth/tokens', headers=headers, expected_status=404, token=adminA_token) # Token will be invalidated but for the below call a new valid # token will be created. 401 is not a correct test as """Common utilities used in testing""" import os import fixtures import testtools class BaseTestCase(testtools.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(BaseTestCase, self).setUp() self._set_timeout() self._fake_output() self.useFixture(fixtures.FakeLogger('keystone.openstack.common')) self.useFixture(fixtures.NestedTempfile()) def _set_timeout(self): test_timeout = os.environ.get('OS_TEST_TIMEOUT', 0) try: test_timeout = int(test_timeout) except ValueError: # If timeout value is invalid do not set a timeout. test_timeout = 0 if test_timeout > 0: self.useFixture(fixtures.Timeout(test_timeout, gentle=True)) def _fake_output(self): if (os.environ.get('OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE') == 'True' or os.environ.get('OS_STDOUT_CAPTURE') == '1'): stdout = self.useFixture(fixtures.StringStream('stdout')).stream self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch('sys.stdout', stdout)) if (os.environ.get('OS_STDERR_CAPTURE') == 'True' or os.environ.get('OS_STDERR_CAPTURE') == '1'): stderr = self.useFixture(fixtures.StringStream('stderr')).stream self.useFixture(fixtures.MonkeyPatch('sys.stderr', stderr))

commit_message:
Add a script to submit changes to all projects

The script is intended to be consumed by OpenStack Infra - but really
could be used by anybody if they want to patch-bomb.

Change-Id: Ia881b2b2eb725d81b1e1dd087f1de235eb9f5962
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/requirements refs/changes/69/48369/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. COMMIT_MSG="Updated from global requirements" TOPIC="openstack/requirements" USERNAME=${USERNAME:-$USER} BRANCH=${1:-master} for PROJECT in $(cat projects.txt); do # See if there is an open change in the openstack/requirements topic # If so, get the change id for the existing change for use in the # commit msg. change_info=$(ssh -p 29418 review.openstack.org gerrit query --current-patch-set status:open project:$PROJECT topic:$TOPIC owner:$USERNAME branch:$BRANCH) previous=$(echo "$change_info" | grep "^ number:" | awk '{print $2}') if [ "x${previous}" != "x" ] ; then change_id=$(echo "$change_info" | grep "^change" | awk '{print $2}') # read return a non zero value when it reaches EOF. Because we use a # heredoc here it will always reach EOF and return a nonzero value. # Disable -e temporarily to get around the read. set +e read -d '' COMMIT_MSG <<EOF $COMMIT_MSG Change-Id: $change_id EOF set -e fi git clone --depth=1 ssh://$USERNAME@review.openstack.org:29418/$PROJECT.git PROJECT_DIR=$(basename $PROJECT) python update.py $PROJECT_DIR pushd $PROJECT_DIR git review -s if ! git diff --quiet ; then # Commit and review git commit -a -F- <<EOF $COMMIT_MSG EOF git review -t $TOPIC $BRANCH fi popd done

commit_message:
Fix console db can't load attribute pool

Lists consoles failed when populate console_type from console
db's pool attribute. The reason was db api console_get_all_by_instance
didn't join with pool. So add param 'columns_to_join' for db api, and
join pool attribute when lists consoles.

Change-Id: I18b44860270a401c55cf02b4334b973fbf357b03
Closes-bug: #1223205

commit_message:
Avoid having twice Appendix A

Both user-guide and user-guide-admin had two versions appendices
labelled "A". The problem was setting appendixAutolabel to 1 in
the pom.xml file and manual overrides of the number in the files.
The patch cleanes all of this up and renames ch_resources.xml
to an appendix part.

security-guide and training-guide also set this variable but did
not have an appendix yet, so remove the variable there as well.

Change-Id: I446f4968b675d3286f2302071ddfa8037425fd6f

commit_message:
Add Server Provider DTO objects

Add DTO(data transfer object) for Servers and Imgages.

This specify and fix returning valeus from different server provider
to simplify work with different server providers and avoid mistakes.

Change-Id: I815ae0bdc977a0f767fee4b2d00473a47def652f

commit_message:
Move and refactor ImmutableMixin & EnumMixin to rally.utils

First of all these two mixins will be used not only for rally.consts
So move it to rally.utils

Improve ImmutableMixin, to be able to set parameters in __init__() method

Relax EnumMixin consts type, were supported only string values

Add tests for ImnutableMixin and EnumMixin

Change-Id: I52a0d3810c62855024bc3da34db1134e8ebde149
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/10/48810/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import itertoolsfrom rally import exceptionsclass ImmutableMixin(object): _inited = False def __init__(self): self._inited = True def __setattr__(self, key, value): if self._inited: raise exceptions.ImmutableException() super(ImmutableMixin, self).__setattr__(key, value) class EnumMixin(object): def __iter__(self): for k, v in itertools.imap(lambda x: (x, getattr(self, x)), dir(self)): if not k.startswith('_'): yield v

subject: Revert "Enable q-vpn service"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-28 12:52:29.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack-gate/commit/71baa816918d8ed29e1891edb3b511e3d9532280', 'message': 'Revert "Enable q-vpn service"

This reverts commit abebbd61eb4758ca5cbab35f3494e7f0262e5bf9.

From the discussion in bug #1230407, the neutron deadlocks may be
a persistent latent issue with driving large amounts of rpc traffic
in neutron. The reason this became an issue this week may be related
to turning on q-vpn in the gate, as that generates even more traffic.

If we revert this change, and things go back to "normal" failure
rates, then this gives us more evidence in that direction.

Change-Id: Ia62dc1cd7efce3aaab5b8825e26082d42f629f88
Related-Bug: 1230407
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Enable q-vpn service"

This reverts commit abebbd61eb4758ca5cbab35f3494e7f0262e5bf9.

From the discussion in bug #1230407, the neutron deadlocks may be
a persistent latent issue with driving large amounts of rpc traffic
in neutron. The reason this became an issue this week may be related
to turning on q-vpn in the gate, as that generates even more traffic.

If we revert this change, and things go back to "normal" failure
rates, then this gives us more evidence in that direction.

Change-Id: Ia62dc1cd7efce3aaab5b8825e26082d42f629f88
Related-Bug: 1230407

subject: Install libffi-dev in SAIO docs.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-24 23:55:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/development_saio.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/d9d7b2135a7020cdf43172ea4fcf0b1020f49101', 'message': 'Install libffi-dev in SAIO docs.

If you don't, then newer versions of xattr won't install, and since
our xattr requirement is simply ">= 0.4" in requirements.txt, this
affects anyone setting up a new SAIO.

This happened with xattr 0.7, which was released on 2013-07-19.

Change-Id: Iaf335fa25a2908953d1fd218158ebedf5d01cc27
'}]
commit_message:
Install libffi-dev in SAIO docs.

If you don't, then newer versions of xattr won't install, and since
our xattr requirement is simply ">= 0.4" in requirements.txt, this
affects anyone setting up a new SAIO.

This happened with xattr 0.7, which was released on 2013-07-19.

Change-Id: Iaf335fa25a2908953d1fd218158ebedf5d01cc27

commit_message:
_get_tenant_by_name doesn't return correctly

If tempest_client is unset, _get_tenant_by_name will
definitely raise an exception, which is incorrect.

Change-Id: Id3e452a35d4f6c7083562689f556cac05868af45
Closes-Bug: #1231645

subject: fix(wsgi): Validation exception strings not written for end users
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-09-28 03:44:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/5009546e938852ddccad2458e64ecd4e1f4deee0', 'message': 'fix: Validation exception strings not written for end users

When input validation fails, the validator raises an exception,
and the WSGI transport may returns the exception string
directly in the body of the error response.

This patch edits the validation exception strings to make them
read more naturally, so that they are more likely to be
understood by end users.

Change-Id: Iad78660d725410d0d9bc05852dca01b3cb3915c6

commit_message:
fix(wsgi): Validation exception strings not written for end users

When input validation fails, the validator raises an exception,
and the WSGI transport may returns the exception string
directly in the body of the error response.

This patch edits the validation exception strings to make them
read more naturally, so that they are more likely to be
understood by end users.

Change-Id: Iad78660d725410d0d9bc05852dca01b3cb3915c6
